topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53686f3063687242578b0000#post_53686f3063687242578b0000
Many countries ban homosexuality. Also, it is irrelevant how many countries or people believe GMOs are safe. Lots of people in government around the world are creationists. Your fallacy is both "argument ad populum":http://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Argumentum_ad_populum and "argument from authority":http://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Argument_from_authority. It's not about who believes it, it's why they believe it.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
A list of countries that ban homosexuality (incomplete):

Algeria.
Egypt.
Libya.
Morocco.
South Sudan.
Sudan.
Tunisia.
Gambia.
Ghana.
Guinea.
Liberia.
Nigeria.
Uganda.
Ethiopia.
Belize.
Dominica.
Grenada.
Trinidad.
Kuwait.
Lebanon
Qatar.
Iran.
India.
Burma.
Cook Islands.
Samoa. 

This list isn't even complete. By the anti-GMO activist's logic, homosexuality is not safe because many countries restrict or ban it.

Also, not all GMOs are supposed to be pesticides. Golden Rice was developed as a humanitarian tool.

"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536872496368722094040000#post_536872496368722094040000
The GMO salmon will only be raised in land-based facilities. Also, the company has proposed only breeding sterile females which cannot interbreed with wild salmon.

It's also not going to be filled with pesticides or anything, unlike Roundup Ready crops. They will just grow faster.
